metadata.synopsis: After the party, this companion is still trying to come down from all the energy, and with a good enough bond it is possible for the player avatar to flirt and unlock a romance option. Gale has been drinking wine, but is not drunk. The wine is mentioned in a few spots, but it shouldn't influence his diction.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Recruit Gale to your partyRecon: oe qnight NIGHT_GoblinHunt_TieflingCelebration_1ad8c357-2695-4d5c-b5f9-8b8c07803121Go to camp and chat with him

3.speaker: Gale
3.text: I've said enough. Let silence do the talking.
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale looks at the player with a big smile and the words are warm and heartfeltNodeContext: You look at the player with a big smile and the words are warm and heartfelt.

4.speaker: Gale
4.text: There's promise in patience, I assure you. Let the night run its course so that we can run ours as well.
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale looks at the player with a big smile and the words are warm and heartfeltNodeContext: You look at the player with a big smile and the words are warm and heartfelt.

36.speaker: Gale
36.text: Enjoy the night. It seems to me full of opportunities.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale looks at the player with a big smile and the words are warm and heartfeltNodeContext: You look at the player with a big smile and the words are warm and heartfelt.

54.speaker: Gale
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale looks at the player with a big smile and the words are warm and heartfeltNodeContext: You look at the player with a big smile and the words are warm and heartfelt.

50.speaker: Player
50.context: NodeContext: Referring to the spell-teaching scene, but the player doesn't know the specifics. This should sound enticing without sounding creepy

19.speaker: Gale
19.context: NodeContext: Referring to the spell-teaching scene, but the player doesn't know the specifics. This should sound enticing without sounding creepy

55.speaker: Gale
55.text: I thank you for seeking me out. Amid all this merriment I wasn't sure we'd have a chance to speak this evening.
55.context: NodeContext: Referring to the spell-teaching scene, but the player doesn't know the specifics. This should sound enticing without sounding creepy

41.speaker: Gale
41.text: Were our bond a little stronger, I might even have shared a moment of magic with you.
41.context: NodeContext: Referring to the spell-teaching scene, but the player doesn't know the specifics. This should sound enticing without sounding creepy

48.speaker: Gale
48.text: Alas, our fledgling acquaintanceship has not yet taken flight. Such intimacy will have to wait.

29.speaker: Gale
29.text: I was hoping you'd spare me a moment. There was something rather magical I wished to show you.
29.context: NodeContext: Referring to the spell-teaching scene, but the player doesn't know the specifics. This should sound enticing without sounding creepy

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I like the sound of 'magical.' What do you have planned?
16.context: NodeContext: Referring to the spell-teaching scene, but the player doesn't know the specifics. This should sound enticing without sounding creepy

14.speaker: Gale
14.text: A lesson. And trust me when I say - few have experienced the pleasure I offer to teach.
14.context: NodeContext: Referring to the spell-teaching scene, but the player doesn't know the specifics. This should sound enticing without sounding creepy

43.speaker: Gale
43.text: However, it's something best experienced in more intimate surrounds, once the revelry has ended, and the stillness of the night has been restored.

12.speaker: Gale
12.text: For now - please, enjoy the celebration. When it is done, I will show you all.

53.speaker: Gale
53.text: As they say in Waterdeep: in wine there is truth.

6.speaker: Gale
6.text: That's usually followed by: in water there is good sense.

40.speaker: Gale
40.text: I promise you - my offer is a perfectly sober one. So, what do you say?

20.speaker: Player
20.text: No thanks, Gale. I'm in no mood for magic this evening.

56.speaker: Gale
56.text: Too bad. One should never be afraid to live life to the fullest.

35.speaker: Gale
35.text: More's the pity you've already found someone else to make merry with, just the two of you.

27.speaker: Gale
27.text: He has a certain charm about him, Astarion. Then again, so does a tiger when it purrs.

60.speaker: Gale
60.text: You might be in for an adventure with Karlach. More than you bargained for - with a bit of luck.

64.speaker: Gale
64.text: Or perhaps more than you bargained for - full stop.

66.speaker: Gale
66.text: Lae'zel. Blade like a razor, wit like a razor, tongue like a razor.

1.speaker: Gale
1.text: I do hope you know what you're doing.

22.speaker: Gale
22.text: Far be it from me of course, to question your tastes.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: What were you going to show me?

32.speaker: Gale
32.text: That, my friend, must remain a secret. For now. Or rather: for as long as you've eyes only for someone else among our troupe.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: And yet you question them nonetheless.

52.speaker: Gale
52.text: Caught on to that, did you? Might be the wine talking.

8.speaker: Gale
8.text: The point is - I have hope. Each new sunrise may yet be the one to coax our budding bond to blossom. But I think it's fair to say -  it won't be today's.

31.speaker: Gale
31.text: Now please, go and enjoy your evening. this won't be the first party I've spent moping in self-indulgence with a bottle of wine for company.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Do I detect a hint of jealousy?

7.speaker: Gale
7.text: Jealousy is in the eye of the beholder. Or something along those lines, the wine might be befuddling me a smidge.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Didn't peg you for a sore loser, Gale.

46.speaker: Gale
46.text: Am I? Perhaps I am. Or perhaps I need another glass of wine.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Actually, I may just want to spend the night with you instead of Astarion.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Actually, I may just want to spend the night with you instead of Karlach.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Actually, I may just want to spend the night with you instead of Lae'zel.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Actually, I may just want to spend the night with you instead of Minsc.

59.speaker: Gale
59.text: You're all too quick to abandon the one you promised yourself to. That is not a quality I admire.

61.speaker: Gale
61.text: I'm glad you feel the same way. But, while I'm eager to enjoy your company on an exclusive basis later this evening, it would be selfish to keep you to myself before then.

38.speaker: Gale
38.text: So please - go, and enjoy the festivities. Anticipation will only make our reunion the sweeter.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Actually, I may just want to spend the night with you instead of Shadowheart.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Actually, I may just want to spend the night with you instead of Wyll.

49.speaker: Gale
49.text: There's something... unspeakable about Shadowheart. But I mean that in a good way. She seems to me like a bud on the cusp of bursting into a rose.

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: Wyll's a good man. He may actually be a tried-and-true storybook hero.

47.speaker: Gale
47.text: Then again he's so full of himself it's a small miracle he hasn't resorted to self-cannibalism yet.

10.speaker: Gale
10.text: I'm glad you sought me out. Amid all this merriment I wasn't sure we'd have a chance to speak this evening.

26.speaker: Gale
26.text: Come now! This is a night for celebration, not suspicion.
